definition: Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
elder brother
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
(coll.) very close male friends
erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]

sentences.english: Buddy, here I've got a cool game to show ya, it's called "Gangstas".
sentences.chinese: 哥們兒，我發現一款超好玩的遊戲，叫“古惑仔”。

sentences.english: Working together with one or more people to put together a killer presentation?
sentences.chinese: 想要和幾個哥們一起搗鼓出一個殺手級的演示文稿？

sentences.english: That is because this bro is too excited to remember to control emotion.
sentences.chinese: 那是因爲這哥們當時情緒已經激動到忘記控制情緒了。

sentences.english: "He loves causing chaos, " a former target-shooting buddy told one reporter.
sentences.chinese: “他熱愛造成混亂，”一前打靶一哥們告訴記者。

sentences.english: I don't want to dice with death by pissing off this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想招惹這哥們兒，自尋死路。

sentences.english: Hey, homie , what's going on here?
sentences.chinese: 嗨，哥們，這發生了什麼事？

sentences.english: I then watched across a 6 lane street as someone stole my bike.
sentences.chinese: 六車道的馬路對面，一哥們又偷了俺的自行車。

sentences.english: We love you even more because you know we need to go out with the guys once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 你需要隔三差五地需要和哥們混在一起，會更愛你。

sentences.english: I must find the pick guy after I out of the exit.
sentences.chinese: 順利出關，得找接我的那個哥們了。

sentences.english: Hi, Monica, this is my number one buddy Ken.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，莫尼卡，這是我最好的哥們兒肯。

sentences.english: "But, " your friend says as he ties a black silk around his eyes.
sentences.chinese: “但是，”你哥們邊說邊蒙個黑絲帶在他眼睛上。

sentences.english: My buddies and I create new schemes and ideas to meet ladies.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的哥們設計了新計劃和新點子來認識女人。

sentences.english: Allan is my dawg , we've been together for 16 years.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫是我哥們，我們在一起有16年了。

sentences.english: Game's up. homie, hang it up like some crank calls.
sentences.chinese: 遊戲結束了，哥們，掛斷它就像是接到奇怪的電話。

sentences.english: Damn Homie, in highschool you was tha man, homie.
sentences.chinese: 喲，哥們，高中的時候你也算個風雲人物呀。

definition: we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
just now/a moment ago
handsome guy/lady-killer/handsome (form of address)
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to take seriously/serious/No joking, really!
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
it doesn't matter
man/fellow/(dialect) husband
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to come in
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to play/to have fun/to hang out
